page.title: 19FOR THE TOURISTS
page.content: Houses and{cottages}may be{rented, there is a{Guest House,}and there is a {Caravan Cafe.}There is a{Holiday {Painting School. People come to look at the stunning {views}of surrounding mountains, lochs and sea; the{Pictish Broch,}the{Viking {Castle,}the{Bishops'}Palace,the Church and former{Cathedral,}the{graveyard with ancestors of those now living in Canada, U.S.A., Australia, New Zealand.{Flowers, birds, rocks}and snails all bring{specialists. { Limekilns}helped to build Glasgow's tenements; a{quarry}gave stone for the {Caledonian Canal.}Corn mills, a flax mill, the legendary{Piper's Cave,}the {Fire Hill}_ the biggest bronze age burial mound in Lorn, the{Staff of St. {Moluag}himself _all are in walking distance. A{boat}takes you{fishing}to islands with{seals,prehistoric caves..
